japan.title: Spirited Away
japan.description: During her family's move to the suburbs, a sullen 10-year-old girl wanders into a world ruled by gods, witches, and spirits, where humans are changed into beasts.
awards: Academy Award for Best Animated Feature
japan.cultural_significance: Considered one of the greatest animated films ever made, it showcases Japanese animation excellence and traditional folklore.

japan.title: Seven Samurai
japan.description: A poor village under attack by bandits recruits seven unemployed samurai to help them defend themselves.
awards: Silver Lion at Venice Film Festival
japan.cultural_significance: Revolutionary film that influenced countless action movies and established Kurosawa as a master filmmaker.

japan.title: Your Name
japan.description: Two strangers find themselves linked in a bizarre way. When a connection forms, will distance be the only thing to keep them apart?
awards: Japan Academy Prize for Animation of the Year
japan.cultural_significance: Modern anime masterpiece that became a global phenomenon, showcasing contemporary Japanese animation.

japan.title: Tokyo Story
japan.description: An elderly couple visit their children and grandchildren in Tokyo, but receive little attention and warm hospitality.
japan.cultural_significance: Ozu's masterpiece exploring family dynamics and generational change in post-war Japan.

italy.title: Life Is Beautiful
italy.description: When an open-minded Jewish librarian and his son become victims of the Holocaust, he uses a perfect mixture of will, humor, and imagination to protect his son from the dangers around their camp.
awards: Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film
italy.cultural_significance: Unique Holocaust film that combines humor with tragedy, showcasing Italian resilience and creativity.

italy.title: Cinema Paradiso
italy.description: A filmmaker recalls his childhood when falling in love with the pictures at the cinema of his home village and forms a deep friendship with the cinema's projectionist.
awards: Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film
italy.cultural_significance: Celebrates the magic of cinema and Italian cultural heritage through the lens of a small Sicilian town.

italy.title: The Bicycle Thief
italy.description: In post-war Italy, a working-class man's bicycle is stolen, endangering his efforts to find work. He and his son set out to find it.
italy.cultural_significance: Landmark of Italian neorealism, depicting post-war poverty and human dignity.

italy.title: La Dolce Vita
italy.description: A series of stories following a week in the life of a philandering tabloid journalist living in Rome.
awards: Palme d'Or at Cannes Film Festival
italy.cultural_significance: Defined the 'sweet life' of 1960s Rome and influenced fashion, culture, and cinema worldwide.

mexico.title: Coco
mexico.description: Aspiring musician Miguel, confronted with his family's ancestral ban on music, enters the Land of the Dead to find his great-great-grandfather, a legendary singer.
awards: Academy Award for Best Animated Feature
Academy Award for Best Original Song
mexico.cultural_significance: Celebrates Mexican culture, particularly Day of the Dead traditions, and family bonds.

mexico.title: Amores Perros
mexico.description: A horrific car accident connects three stories, each involving characters dealing with loss, regret, and life's harsh realities.
awards: Academy Award nomination for Best Foreign Language Film
mexico.cultural_significance: Launched the Mexican New Wave in cinema and established I√±√°rritu as a major director.

mexico.title: Roma
mexico.description: A year in the life of a middle-class family's maid in Mexico City in the early 1970s.
awards: Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film
mexico.cultural_significance: Personal film exploring class, race, and gender in 1970s Mexico through intimate storytelling.

mexico.title: Y Tu Mam√° Tambi√©n
mexico.description: In Mexico, two teenage boys and an attractive older woman embark on a road trip and learn a thing or two about life, friendship, sex, and each other.
awards: Academy Award nomination for Best Original Screenplay
mexico.cultural_significance: Coming-of-age story that captures the social and political climate of late 1990s Mexico.

india.title: Lagaan: Once Upon a Time in India
india.description: The people of a small village in Victorian India stake their future on a game of cricket against their ruthless British rulers.
awards: Academy Award nomination for Best Foreign Language Film
india.cultural_significance: Epic sports drama that showcases Indian resilience and became a global phenomenon.

india.title: 3 Idiots
india.description: Two friends looking for a lost buddy deal with a forgotten bet, a wedding they have to crash and a reunion.
awards: National Film Award for Best Popular Film
india.cultural_significance: Addresses India's education system and societal pressures while entertaining audiences worldwide.

india.title: Pather Panchali
india.description: Impoverished priest Harihar Ray, dreaming of a better life for himself and his family, leaves his rural Bengal village in search of work.
awards: Cannes Film Festival Best Human Document
india.cultural_significance: First film in Ray's Apu Trilogy, establishing Indian cinema on the world stage.

india.title: Dangal
india.description: Former wrestler Mahavir Singh Phogat and his two wrestler daughters struggle towards glory at the Commonwealth Games in the face of societal oppression.
awards: National Film Award for Best Film
india.cultural_significance: Based on true story, challenges gender stereotypes and celebrates women's empowerment in sports.

france.title: Am√©lie
france.description: Am√©lie, an innocent and naive girl in Paris, with her own sense of justice, decides to help those around her and along the way, discovers love.
awards: Academy Award nominations for Best Foreign Language Film
france.cultural_significance: Whimsical love letter to Paris that captured the world's imagination with its magical realism.

france.title: The 400 Blows
france.description: A young boy, left without attention, delves into a life of petty crime.
france.cultural_significance: Seminal film of the French New Wave, revolutionizing cinema with its naturalistic style.

france.title: Blue Is the Warmest Color
france.description: Ad√®le's life is changed when she meets Emma, a young woman with blue hair, who will allow her to discover desire and assert herself as a woman and as an adult.
awards: Palme d'Or at Cannes Film Festival
france.cultural_significance: Groundbreaking film exploring female sexuality and coming-of-age with unprecedented honesty.

france.title: Breathless
france.description: A small-time thief steals a car and impulsively murders a motorcycle policeman. Wanted by the authorities, he attempts to persuade a girl to run away to Italy with him.
awards: Berlin Film Festival Silver Bear for Best Director
france.cultural_significance: Revolutionary film that broke all cinematic conventions and defined the French New Wave.

germany.title: Metropolis
germany.description: In a futuristic city sharply divided between the working class and the city planners, the son of the city's mastermind falls in love with a working class prophet who predicts the coming of a savior to mediate their differences.
awards: UNESCO Memory of the World Register
germany.cultural_significance: Revolutionary silent film that influenced science fiction cinema and visual storytelling for decades.

germany.title: Run Lola Run
germany.description: After a botched money delivery, Lola has 20 minutes to come up with 100,000 Deutschmarks to save her boyfriend's life.
awards: Bavarian Film Award for Best Director
germany.cultural_significance: Innovative film that explores fate and chance through multiple narrative paths and fast-paced storytelling.

germany.title: The Lives of Others
germany.description: In 1984 East Berlin, an agent of the secret police, conducting surveillance on a writer and his lover, finds himself becoming increasingly absorbed by their lives.
awards: Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film
germany.cultural_significance: Powerful examination of surveillance, art, and human dignity in East Germany before the fall of the Berlin Wall.

germany.title: Good Bye, Lenin!
germany.description: In 1990, to protect his fragile mother from a fatal shock after a long coma, a young man must keep her from learning that her beloved nation of East Germany has disappeared.
awards: European Film Award for Best Film
germany.cultural_significance: Heartwarming comedy that explores the personal impact of German reunification and family bonds.

china.title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
china.description: A young Chinese warrior steals a sword from a famed swordsman and then escapes into a world of romantic adventure with a mysterious man in the frontier of the nation.
awards: Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film
china.cultural_significance: Revolutionized martial arts cinema and brought Chinese wuxia films to global audiences. Showcases traditional Chinese philosophy and martial arts culture.

china.title: Farewell My Concubine
china.description: Two boys meet at an opera training school in Peking in 1924. Their 44-year friendship reflects the troubled history of China.
awards: Oscar nomination for Best Foreign Language Film
china.cultural_significance: Masterpiece of Chinese cinema that explores the intersection of art, politics, and personal relationships during China's turbulent 20th century.

china.title: Hero
china.description: A defense officer, Nameless, was summoned by the King of Qin regarding his success of terminating three warriors.
awards: Oscar nomination for Best Foreign Language Film
china.cultural_significance: Beautifully shot martial arts film that explores themes of sacrifice, honor, and the unification of China. Features stunning cinematography and choreography.

china.title: In the Mood for Love
china.description: A man and a woman move into neighboring Hong Kong apartments and form a bond when they both suspect their spouses of infidelity.
awards: Cannes Film Festival Technical Grand Prize
china.cultural_significance: Masterpiece of Hong Kong cinema that captures the mood and atmosphere of 1960s Hong Kong. Known for its stunning cinematography and emotional depth.

cuba.title: Memories of Underdevelopment
cuba.description: A bourgeois intellectual struggles to adapt to the new socialist reality in post-revolutionary Cuba.
awards: International recognition as a masterpiece of Cuban cinema
cuba.cultural_significance: Landmark film of Cuban cinema that explores the social and political changes following the Cuban Revolution. Considered one of the most important Latin American films.

cuba.title: Strawberry and Chocolate
cuba.description: A young communist student and a gay artist form an unlikely friendship in Havana.
awards: Oscar nomination for Best Foreign Language Film
cuba.cultural_significance: Groundbreaking Cuban film that addresses homosexuality and tolerance in Cuban society. One of the first Cuban films to receive international recognition.

cuba.title: Buena Vista Social Club
cuba.description: Documentary about Cuban musicians and their traditional music, featuring the legendary Buena Vista Social Club.
awards: Oscar nomination for Best Documentary Feature
cuba.cultural_significance: Brought international attention to Cuban music and culture. The film and album helped revive interest in traditional Cuban son music worldwide.

cuba.title: Honey for Osh√∫n
cuba.description: A Cuban-American returns to Cuba to find his mother and discovers his cultural roots.
cuba.cultural_significance: Explores themes of Cuban diaspora and cultural identity. Represents the connection between Cuban-Americans and their homeland.

korea.title: Parasite
korea.description: Greed and class discrimination threaten the newly formed symbiotic relationship between the wealthy Park family and the destitute Kim clan.
korea.cultural_significance: First non-English language film to win Best Picture at the Oscars. Brilliantly satirizes class inequality and showcases the excellence of Korean cinema.

korea.title: Oldboy
korea.description: After being kidnapped and imprisoned for fifteen years, Oh Dae-Su is released, only to find that he must find his captor in five days.
awards: Grand Prix at Cannes Film Festival
korea.cultural_significance: Revolutionary Korean thriller that redefined the revenge genre. Known for its shocking plot twists and innovative cinematography.

korea.title: Train to Busan
korea.description: While a zombie virus breaks out in South Korea, passengers struggle to survive on the train from Seoul to Busan.
korea.cultural_significance: Successful Korean zombie film that combines horror with social commentary. Helped popularize Korean genre films internationally.

korea.title: Memories of Murder
korea.description: In a small Korean province in 1986, two detectives struggle with the case of multiple young women being found raped and murdered by an unknown culprit.
korea.cultural_significance: Based on true events, this film explores the psychology of crime investigation and showcases early work from acclaimed director Bong Joon-ho.

russia.title: Stalker
russia.description: A guide leads two men through an area known as the Zone to find a room that grants wishes.
awards: Cannes Film Festival Prize of the Ecumenical Jury
russia.cultural_significance: Masterpiece of Soviet cinema that explores philosophical themes through science fiction. Known for its meditative pace and stunning cinematography.

russia.title: The Mirror
russia.description: A dying man in his forties remembers his past. His childhood, his mother, the war, personal moments and things that tell of the recent history of all the Russian nation.
russia.cultural_significance: Autobiographical masterpiece that weaves personal memory with Russian history. Considered one of the most poetic films ever made.

russia.title: Leviathan
russia.description: In a Russian coastal town, Kolya is forced to fight the corrupt mayor when he is told that his house will be demolished.
awards: Golden Globe for Best Foreign Language Film
russia.cultural_significance: Modern Russian masterpiece that critiques corruption and power structures in contemporary Russia. Known for its powerful social commentary.

russia.title: Battle for Sevastopol
russia.description: The story of Soviet sniper Lyudmila Pavlichenko, the most successful female sniper in world history.
russia.cultural_significance: Based on the true story of a legendary Soviet sniper, this film showcases Russian war cinema and female heroism during World War II.

egypt.title: Cairo Station
egypt.description: A crippled newspaper seller at Cairo's main train station develops an unhealthy obsession with a beautiful drinks seller.
awards: Berlin International Film Festival Official Selection
egypt.cultural_significance: Landmark Egyptian film that introduced neorealism to Arab cinema. Explores social issues and urban life in 1950s Cairo.

egypt.title: The Mummy
egypt.description: At an archaeological dig in the ancient city of Hamunaptra, an American serving in the French Foreign Legion accidentally awakens a mummy.
egypt.cultural_significance: Hollywood blockbuster that brought ancient Egyptian mythology to global audiences. While not Egyptian-made, it popularized Egyptian cultural elements.

egypt.title: The Yacoubian Building
egypt.description: The lives of the residents of a once-elegant apartment building in downtown Cairo reflect the changes in Egyptian society.
egypt.cultural_significance: Important Egyptian film that explores social change and class dynamics in modern Cairo. Based on a bestselling novel.

egypt.title: Clash
egypt.description: A group of journalists and protesters from opposing political sides are trapped in a police truck during the Egyptian revolution.
egypt.cultural_significance: Powerful film about the Egyptian revolution that captures the political tensions and human drama of the period.

ethiopia.title: Lamb
ethiopia.description: A young Ethiopian boy is sent to live with distant relatives, but he struggles to adapt to his new life.
ethiopia.cultural_significance: First Ethiopian film to be selected for the Cannes Film Festival. Provides a rare glimpse into rural Ethiopian life and culture.

ethiopia.title: Difret
ethiopia.description: A young Ethiopian girl is kidnapped as part of a traditional abduction marriage practice, but she fights back.
ethiopia.cultural_significance: Important Ethiopian film that addresses traditional practices and women's rights. Based on a true story and shot in Ethiopia.

ethiopia.title: Teza
ethiopia.description: An Ethiopian intellectual returns home after studying abroad, only to find his country under military rule.
awards: Venice Film Festival Special Jury Prize
ethiopia.cultural_significance: Landmark Ethiopian film that explores the country's political history and the experience of returning intellectuals.

ethiopia.title: Price of Love
ethiopia.description: A taxi driver in Addis Ababa falls in love with a prostitute, but their relationship faces many challenges.
ethiopia.cultural_significance: Modern Ethiopian film that explores contemporary urban life and relationships in Addis Ababa.

argentina.title: The Official Story
argentina.description: A high school teacher begins to question the origins of her adopted daughter during the military dictatorship in Argentina.
awards: Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film
argentina.cultural_significance: First Argentine film to win an Oscar. Addresses the painful legacy of the military dictatorship and the stolen children scandal.

argentina.title: Wild Tales
argentina.description: Six short stories about people in distress, exploring the thin line that separates civilization from barbarism.
awards: Oscar nomination for Best Foreign Language Film
argentina.cultural_significance: Modern Argentine masterpiece that explores themes of revenge and social justice. Showcases contemporary Argentine cinema excellence.

argentina.title: Nine Queens
argentina.description: Two con artists try to sell a sheet of counterfeit stamps to a collector.
argentina.cultural_significance: Clever Argentine thriller that showcases the country's talent for complex, engaging storytelling.

argentina.title: The Secret in Their Eyes
argentina.description: A retired legal counselor writes a novel hoping to find closure for one of his past unresolved homicide cases.
awards: Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film
argentina.cultural_significance: Second Argentine film to win an Oscar. Combines crime thriller with romance and explores Argentina's judicial system.

brazil.title: City of God
brazil.description: Two boys growing up in a violent neighborhood of Rio de Janeiro take different paths: one becomes a photographer, the other a drug dealer.
brazil.cultural_significance: Revolutionary Brazilian film that brought favela life to global audiences. Known for its innovative cinematography and powerful social commentary.

brazil.title: Central Station
brazil.description: An emotive journey of a former school teacher who writes letters for illiterate people and a young boy whose mother has just died.
awards: Oscar nomination for Best Foreign Language Film
Golden Globe for Best Foreign Language Film
brazil.cultural_significance: Beautiful Brazilian road movie that explores the vastness of Brazil and the human connections that transcend social barriers.

brazil.title: Elite Squad
brazil.description: Based on true events, the film shows how BOPE, a special police unit in Rio de Janeiro, tries to take control of the slums.
brazil.cultural_significance: Gritty Brazilian crime film that provides an unflinching look at police corruption and violence in Rio's favelas.

brazil.title: Black Orpheus
brazil.description: A retelling of the Orpheus and Eurydice myth, set during the Carnival in Rio de Janeiro.
awards: Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film
brazil.cultural_significance: Classic Brazilian film that introduced global audiences to Brazilian music, culture, and the magic of Carnival.

thailand.title: Uncle Boonmee Who Can Recall His Past Lives
thailand.description: Suffering from acute kidney failure, Uncle Boonmee treks through the jungle with his family to a mysterious hilltop cave.
awards: Palme d'Or at Cannes Film Festival
thailand.cultural_significance: First Thai film to win the Palme d'Or. Explores Buddhist concepts of reincarnation and Thai spiritual beliefs.

thailand.title: Bad Genius
thailand.description: A genius high school student who makes money by helping other students cheat on tests gets involved in an international cheating ring.
thailand.cultural_significance: Successful Thai thriller that explores academic pressure and corruption in education. Became a hit across Asia.

thailand.title: Tropical Malady
thailand.description: A soldier and a country boy fall in love, but their relationship is tested when the boy transforms into a shaman.
thailand.cultural_significance: Experimental Thai film that blends reality with folklore and explores themes of love, transformation, and Thai mythology.

thailand.title: Ong-Bak: The Thai Warrior
thailand.description: When the head of a statue sacred to a village is stolen, a young martial artist goes to the big city and finds himself taking on the underworld.
thailand.cultural_significance: Revolutionary Thai action film that introduced Muay Thai to global audiences and launched Tony Jaa's international career.

spain.title: Pan's Labyrinth
spain.description: In the Falangist Spain of 1944, the bookish young stepdaughter of a sadistic army officer escapes into an eerie but captivating fantasy world.
spain.cultural_significance: Masterpiece of Spanish cinema that combines historical reality with dark fantasy. Explores the brutality of Franco's Spain through magical realism.

spain.title: All About My Mother
spain.description: Young Esteban wants to become a writer and also to discover the identity of his second mother, a trans woman, carefully concealed by his mother Manuela.
awards: Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film
spain.cultural_significance: Landmark Spanish film that explores gender identity and motherhood. Showcases Pedro Almod√≥var's unique vision and Spanish cinema excellence.

spain.title: Open Your Eyes
spain.description: A very handsome man finds the love of his life, but he suffers an accident and needs to have his face rebuilt by surgery after it is severely disfigured.
spain.cultural_significance: Innovative Spanish thriller that explores identity and reality. Later remade as 'Vanilla Sky' in Hollywood, showcasing Spanish cinema's influence.

spain.title: Volver
spain.description: After her death, a mother returns to her home town in order to fix the situations she couldn't resolve during her life.
awards: Cannes Film Festival Best Actress Award
spain.cultural_significance: Celebrates female strength and Spanish family bonds. Features strong female characters and explores themes of motherhood and redemption.

greece.title: Never on Sunday
greece.description: An American tourist in Greece attempts to make a prostitute into a respectable woman.
greece.cultural_significance: Iconic Greek film that introduced international audiences to Greek culture and music. The title song became a global hit.

greece.title: Dogtooth
greece.description: A controlling, manipulative father locks his three adult offspring in a state of perpetual childhood by keeping them prisoner within the sprawling family compound.
awards: Cannes Film Festival Un Certain Regard Award
greece.cultural_significance: Revolutionary Greek film that established the 'Greek Weird Wave' movement. Known for its unique style and disturbing themes.

greece.title: The Lobster
greece.description: In a dystopian near future, single people, according to the laws of The City, are taken to The Hotel, where they are obliged to find a romantic partner in 45 days or are transformed into beasts and sent off into The Woods.
greece.cultural_significance: International co-production directed by Greek filmmaker Yorgos Lanthimos. Showcases the global reach of Greek cinema talent.

greece.title: Z
greece.description: The public prosecutor's investigation of a prominent politician's assassination reveals the involvement of the military and the police.
awards: Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film
greece.cultural_significance: Powerful Greek political thriller that critiques authoritarianism. Based on real events and showcases Greek cinema's political engagement.

morocco.title: Omar Killed Me
morocco.description: The story of Omar Raddad, a Moroccan gardener who was convicted of murdering his employer in 1991 and spent seven years in prison.
morocco.cultural_significance: Important Moroccan film that explores justice and social issues. Based on a true story that captured national attention.

morocco.title: Much Loved
morocco.description: The story of four prostitutes in Marrakech and their daily struggles with family, love, and society.
morocco.cultural_significance: Controversial Moroccan film that addresses taboo subjects. Banned in Morocco but internationally acclaimed for its honesty.

morocco.title: The Way
morocco.description: A father heads overseas to recover the body of his estranged son who died while traveling the 'El camino de Santiago' from France to Spain.
morocco.cultural_significance: While not Moroccan-made, this film showcases the cultural and spiritual significance of the Camino de Santiago pilgrimage route.

morocco.title: Horses of God
morocco.description: Based on the 2003 Casablanca bombings, the film follows four friends from the slums of Casablanca who become suicide bombers.
morocco.cultural_significance: Powerful Moroccan film that explores the roots of extremism. Based on real events and provides insight into contemporary Moroccan society.

malaysia.title: The Babymaker
malaysia.description: A young woman's journey to become a surrogate mother, exploring family and cultural expectations.
malaysia.cultural_significance: Addresses contemporary Malaysian social issues and family dynamics.

malaysia.title: The Second Life of Thieves
malaysia.description: Two former thieves try to go straight but find themselves drawn back into their old ways.
malaysia.cultural_significance: Explores themes of redemption and second chances in Malaysian society.

singapore.title: I Loaf U
singapore.description: A romantic comedy about a baker who falls in love with a customer.
singapore.cultural_significance: Showcases Singaporean culture and the local food scene.

singapore.title: 7 Letters
singapore.description: Seven short films by seven Singaporean directors exploring the nation's identity.
singapore.cultural_significance: Celebrates Singapore's 50th anniversary and showcases local filmmaking talent.

indonesia.title: The Act of Killing
indonesia.description: Filmmakers challenge former Indonesian death-squad leaders to reenact their mass-killings in various cinematic genres.
awards: Oscar nomination for Best Documentary Feature
indonesia.cultural_significance: Powerful documentary that explores Indonesia's dark history and the perpetrators of mass violence.

indonesia.title: The Look of Silence
indonesia.description: A family that survives the genocide in Indonesia confronts the men who killed one of their brothers.
awards: Oscar nomination for Best Documentary Feature
indonesia.cultural_significance: Companion piece to 'The Act of Killing' that gives voice to the victims and their families.

indonesia.title: Marlina the Murderer in Four Acts
indonesia.description: A woman seeks revenge after being robbed and sexually assaulted by a group of men.
indonesia.cultural_significance: Revolutionary Indonesian film that reimagines the western genre and explores female empowerment.

philippines.title: Himala
philippines.description: A young woman claims to have seen the Virgin Mary and begins performing miracles.
philippines.cultural_significance: Iconic Filipino film that explores faith, miracles, and the human condition.

philippines.title: Metro Manila
philippines.description: A farmer moves to Manila with his family in search of a better life, but gets caught up in the city's criminal underworld.
philippines.cultural_significance: Explores the challenges of rural-urban migration and the harsh realities of life in Manila.

philippines.title: Birdshot
philippines.description: A young farm girl accidentally kills a protected eagle, setting off a chain of events involving corrupt police and government officials.
awards: Tokyo International Film Festival Best Picture
philippines.cultural_significance: Addresses environmental protection and corruption in the Philippines.

vietnam.title: The Scent of Green Papaya
vietnam.description: A young girl from the countryside is sent to work as a servant in a Saigon household.
awards: Oscar nomination for Best Foreign Language Film
vietnam.cultural_significance: First Vietnamese film to be nominated for an Oscar. Showcases Vietnamese culture and family life.

vietnam.title: Cyclo
vietnam.description: A young cyclo driver in Ho Chi Minh City gets involved in organized crime to support his family.
vietnam.cultural_significance: Award-winning Vietnamese film that explores urban poverty and crime in Ho Chi Minh City.

vietnam.title: The Vertical Ray of the Sun
vietnam.description: Three sisters prepare for their mother's death anniversary while dealing with their own relationships and secrets.
vietnam.cultural_significance: Explores Vietnamese family dynamics and the importance of tradition and memory.

cambodia.title: The Killing Fields
cambodia.description: A journalist is trapped in Cambodia during tyrant Pol Pot's deadly 'Year Zero' cleansing campaign.
cambodia.cultural_significance: While not Cambodian-made, this film brought global attention to the Cambodian genocide and its devastating impact.

cambodia.title: First They Killed My Father
cambodia.description: Based on the memoir of Loung Ung, a young girl's experience during the Cambodian genocide.
awards: Golden Globe nomination for Best Foreign Language Film
cambodia.cultural_significance: Important film that tells the Cambodian genocide story from a child's perspective, directed by Angelina Jolie.

laos.title: Dearest Sister
laos.description: A young woman from rural Laos moves to the city to care for her wealthy cousin who is going blind.
laos.cultural_significance: First Laotian horror film to gain international recognition. Explores class differences and supernatural beliefs.

laos.title: The Long Walk
laos.description: An old Laotian man who can see ghosts embarks on a journey to find the ghost of his dead wife.
laos.cultural_significance: Innovative Laotian film that blends science fiction with traditional beliefs and explores themes of love and loss.

myanmar.title: The Road to Mandalay
myanmar.description: Two young people from Myanmar try to make a living in Thailand while dealing with their relationship.
myanmar.cultural_significance: Explores the challenges faced by Myanmar migrants in Thailand and the complexities of their relationships.

myanmar.title: Ice Poison
myanmar.description: A father and son from rural Myanmar travel to the city to sell drugs to support their family.
myanmar.cultural_significance: Addresses the drug trade and rural poverty in Myanmar, showing the desperate choices people make to survive.

pakistan.title: Khuda Ke Liye
pakistan.description: Two musicians face religious extremism and cultural conflicts in Pakistan and Afghanistan.
pakistan.cultural_significance: Addresses religious extremism and cultural identity in Pakistan. One of the most successful Pakistani films.

pakistan.title: Bol
pakistan.description: A father on death row tells his story of family struggles and societal issues.
pakistan.cultural_significance: Explores social issues in Pakistan including gender discrimination and family dynamics.

bangladesh.title: The Clay Bird
bangladesh.description: A young boy is sent to a religious school during the turbulent 1960s in East Pakistan.
bangladesh.cultural_significance: First Bangladeshi film to be selected for Cannes. Explores religious education and political turmoil.

bangladesh.title: Antaratma
bangladesh.description: A woman's journey of self-discovery and spiritual awakening.
bangladesh.cultural_significance: Explores spiritual themes and women's empowerment in Bangladeshi society.

sri_lanka.title: Between Two Worlds
sri_lanka.description: A young woman navigates between traditional and modern life in Sri Lanka.
sri_lanka.cultural_significance: Explores the clash between tradition and modernity in Sri Lankan society.

sri_lanka.title: With Love to You
sri_lanka.description: A love story set against the backdrop of Sri Lanka's beautiful landscapes.
sri_lanka.cultural_significance: Showcases Sri Lankan culture and landscapes through a romantic narrative.

nepal.title: Highway
nepal.description: A road movie exploring the lives of people along Nepal's highways.
nepal.cultural_significance: First Nepali film to be selected for Venice. Explores life along Nepal's transportation routes.

nepal.title: White Sun
nepal.description: A political drama set in post-civil war Nepal.
nepal.cultural_significance: Addresses post-war reconciliation and political tensions in Nepal.

bhutan.title: The Cup
bhutan.description: Young Buddhist monks in Bhutan are excited about the World Cup soccer tournament.
bhutan.cultural_significance: First Bhutanese film to gain international recognition. Shows the intersection of tradition and modernity.

bhutan.title: Travellers and Magicians
bhutan.description: A government official's journey through Bhutan's beautiful landscapes.
bhutan.cultural_significance: Showcases Bhutan's stunning landscapes and traditional culture.

australia.title: Mad Max: Fury Road
australia.description: In a post-apocalyptic wasteland, a woman rebels against a tyrannical ruler in search for her homeland with the aid of a group of female prisoners, a psychotic worshiper, and a drifter named Max.
awards: Academy Award for Best Costume Design
Academy Award for Best Production Design
australia.cultural_significance: Revolutionary action film that showcases Australian filmmaking excellence and post-apocalyptic storytelling.

australia.title: The Water Diviner
australia.description: An Australian farmer travels to Turkey after the Battle of Gallipoli to try to locate his three missing sons.
awards: Australian Academy of Cinema and Television Arts Awards
australia.cultural_significance: Explores Australia's involvement in World War I and the Gallipoli campaign.

canada.title: Room
canada.description: A young boy is raised within the confines of a small room where his mother has been held captive for seven years.
canada.cultural_significance: Canadian-Irish co-production that showcases powerful storytelling and emotional depth.

canada.title: Bon Cop, Bad Cop
canada.description: Two police officers from different provinces must work together to solve a murder case.
awards: Genie Award for Best Motion Picture
canada.cultural_significance: Celebrates Canadian bilingualism and cultural diversity through comedy.

united_kingdom.title: The King's Speech
united_kingdom.description: The story of King George VI, his impromptu ascension to the throne of the British Empire in 1936, and the speech therapist who helped the unsure monarch overcome his stammer.
united_kingdom.cultural_significance: Showcases British royal history and the power of determination and friendship.

united_kingdom.title: Slumdog Millionaire
united_kingdom.description: A Mumbai teenager reflects on his upbringing in the slums when he is asked to appear on the Indian version of 'Who Wants To Be A Millionaire?'
united_kingdom.cultural_significance: British film that explores Indian culture and the power of hope and determination.

france.title: Am√©lie
france.description: Am√©lie, an innocent and naive girl in Paris, with her own sense of justice, decides to help those around her and along the way, discovers love.
france.cultural_significance: Celebrates Parisian culture and the magic of everyday life in France.

france.title: La La Land
france.description: While navigating their careers in Los Angeles, a pianist and an actress fall in love while attempting to reconcile their aspirations for the future.
france.cultural_significance: Revitalizes the musical genre and celebrates artistic dreams and love.

germany.title: Run Lola Run
germany.description: After a botched money delivery, Lola has 20 minutes to come up with 100,000 Deutschmarks to save her boyfriend's life.
germany.cultural_significance: Revolutionary German film that explores fate, time, and the consequences of choices.

germany.title: The Lives of Others
germany.description: In 1984 East Berlin, an agent of the secret police, conducting surveillance on a writer and his lover, finds himself becoming increasingly absorbed by their lives.
awards: Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film
germany.cultural_significance: Explores the surveillance state in East Germany and the power of art and human connection.

spain.title: Pan's Labyrinth
spain.description: In the Falangist Spain of 1944, the bookish young stepdaughter of a sadistic army officer escapes into an eerie but captivating fantasy world.
awards: Academy Award for Best Art Direction
spain.cultural_significance: Spanish-Mexican co-production that explores the horrors of war through magical realism.

spain.title: Volver
spain.description: After her death, a mother returns to her home town in order to fix the situations she couldn't resolve during her life.
awards: Cannes Film Festival Best Actress Award
spain.cultural_significance: Celebrates Spanish culture, family bonds, and the strength of women.

netherlands.title: Black Book
netherlands.description: In the Nazi-occupied Netherlands during World War II, a Jewish singer infiltrates the regional Gestapo headquarters for the Dutch resistance.
netherlands.cultural_significance: Explores Dutch resistance during WWII and the moral complexities of survival.

sweden.title: Let the Right One In
sweden.description: A bullied 12-year-old boy befriends a young vampire in a Stockholm suburb.
sweden.cultural_significance: Revolutionary Swedish horror film that explores loneliness and friendship.

norway.title: Trollhunter
norway.description: A group of students investigates a series of mysterious bear killings, only to discover something bigger than they ever imagined.
awards: Amanda Award for Best Visual Effects
norway.cultural_significance: Showcases Norwegian folklore and the found footage genre.

denmark.title: The Hunt
denmark.description: A teacher lives a lonely life, all the while struggling over his son's custody. His life slowly gets better as he finds love and receives good news from his son, but his new luck is about to be brutally shattered by an innocent little lie.
awards: Cannes Film Festival Best Actor Award
denmark.cultural_significance: Explores themes of truth, lies, and the impact of false accusations in Danish society.

finland.title: The Man Without a Past
finland.description: A man arrives in Helsinki and gets beaten up so severely he develops amnesia. Unable to remember his name or anything from his past life, he cannot get a job or an apartment, so he starts living on the outskirts of the city.
finland.cultural_significance: Showcases Finnish humor and the resilience of the human spirit.

poland.title: Ida
poland.description: A young novitiate in 1960s Poland discovers a family secret dating back to the years of the Nazi occupation.
awards: Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film
poland.cultural_significance: Explores Polish history, identity, and the impact of WWII on families.

czech_republic.title: Kolya
czech_republic.description: A Czech man forms an unexpected friendship with a Russian boy who is left in his care.
awards: Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film
czech_republic.cultural_significance: Explores Czech-Russian relations and the power of unexpected friendships.

hungary.title: Son of Saul
hungary.description: In the horror of 1944 Auschwitz, a prisoner forced to burn the corpses of his own people finds moral survival upon trying to save from the flames the body of a boy he takes for his son.
awards: Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film
hungary.cultural_significance: Powerful Hungarian film about the Holocaust and human dignity.

romania.title: 4 Months, 3 Weeks and 2 Days
romania.description: A woman assists her friend in arranging an illegal abortion in 1980s Romania.
romania.cultural_significance: Explores life under Ceau»ôescu's regime and women's rights in Romania.

croatia.title: Quitting Smoking
croatia.description: A man tries to quit smoking while dealing with various life challenges.
croatia.cultural_significance: Showcases Croatian humor and everyday life challenges.

ukraine.title: The Tribe
ukraine.description: A deaf teenager joins a boarding school where he discovers a violent and criminal world.
awards: Cannes Film Festival Critics' Week Grand Prize
ukraine.cultural_significance: Revolutionary Ukrainian film that explores communication and violence.

turkey.title: Winter Sleep
turkey.description: A hotel owner and landlord in a remote Turkish village deals with conflicts with his tenants, family and others.
turkey.cultural_significance: Explores Turkish society, class differences, and human relationships.

iran.title: A Separation
iran.description: A married couple are faced with a difficult decision - to improve the life of their child by moving to another country or to stay in Iran and look after a deteriorating parent who has Alzheimer's disease.
awards: Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film
iran.cultural_significance: Explores Iranian family dynamics and moral choices in contemporary society.

israel.title: Waltz with Bashir
israel.description: An Israeli film director interviews fellow veterans of the 1982 invasion of Lebanon to reconstruct his own memories of his term of service in that conflict.
awards: Golden Globe Award for Best Foreign Language Film
israel.cultural_significance: Explores Israeli military history and the impact of war on memory.

lebanon.title: Caramel
lebanon.description: Five Lebanese women deal with issues of love, sexuality, tradition, and personal freedom in Beirut.
lebanon.cultural_significance: Explores women's lives and social issues in contemporary Lebanon.

saudi_arabia.title: Wadjda
saudi_arabia.description: A determined young Saudi girl enters a Koran recitation competition at her school and hopes to win enough money to buy her own bicycle.
saudi_arabia.cultural_significance: First feature film shot entirely in Saudi Arabia, exploring women's rights and childhood dreams.

nigeria.title: Lionheart
nigeria.description: A woman must find a way to keep her father's company afloat in a male-dominated industry.
awards: Toronto International Film Festival Official Selection
nigeria.cultural_significance: First Netflix original film from Nigeria, exploring women in business and family dynamics.

south_africa.title: District 9
south_africa.description: Violence ensues after an extraterrestrial race forced to live in slum-like conditions on Earth finds a kindred spirit in a government agent exposed to their biotechnology.
awards: Academy Award for Best Visual Effects Nomination
south_africa.cultural_significance: Revolutionary South African film that explores apartheid themes through science fiction.

peru.title: The Milk of Sorrow
peru.description: A young woman from the Andes is afraid of men due to the stories her mother told her about the rape and abuse during Peru's civil war.
awards: Berlin International Film Festival Golden Bear
peru.cultural_significance: Explores the impact of Peru's civil war on women and indigenous communities.

colombia.title: Embrace of the Serpent
colombia.description: The story of the relationship between Karamakate, an Amazonian shaman and last survivor of his people, and two scientists who work together over the course of 40 years to explore the Amazon.
awards: Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film Nomination
colombia.cultural_significance: Explores Colombian Amazon culture and the impact of colonialism.

chile.title: A Fantastic Woman
chile.description: A transgender woman deals with the death of her partner and the discrimination she faces from his family and society.
awards: Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film
chile.cultural_significance: Explores transgender rights and acceptance in Chilean society.

ecuador.title: Porcelain Horse
ecuador.description: A young man returns to his hometown in Ecuador to confront his past and family secrets.
awards: Guadalajara International Film Festival Official Selection
ecuador.cultural_significance: Explores Ecuadorian family dynamics and the search for identity.

uruguay.title: A Giant
uruguay.description: A young man with gigantism struggles with his condition and society's perception of him in Uruguay.
awards: San Sebasti√°n International Film Festival Official Selection
uruguay.cultural_significance: Explores acceptance and difference in Uruguayan society.

austria.title: The White Ribbon
austria.description: Strange events happen in a small village in the north of Germany during the years before World War I.
awards: Palme d'Or at Cannes Film Festival
Oscar nomination for Best Foreign Language Film
austria.cultural_significance: Explores the roots of fascism and violence in pre-war Germany, directed by acclaimed Austrian filmmaker Michael Haneke.

austria.title: Amour
austria.description: Georges and Anne are in their eighties. They are cultivated, retired music teachers. Their daughter, also a musician, lives in Britain with her family.
awards: Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film
Palme d'Or at Cannes Film Festival
austria.cultural_significance: Powerful exploration of love, aging, and mortality. Won the Palme d'Or and Oscar for Best Foreign Language Film.

austria.title: Funny Games
austria.description: Two violent young men take a mother, father, and son hostage in their vacation cabin and force them to play sadistic games.
austria.cultural_significance: Controversial film that critiques violence in media and society. Remade by Haneke himself in 2007.

austria.title: The Seventh Continent
austria.description: A family living in Austria decides to destroy their lives and commit suicide together.
austria.cultural_significance: Michael Haneke's feature debut that established his distinctive style and themes.

belgium.title: Man Bites Dog
belgium.description: A film crew follows a serial killer, recording his crimes for a documentary.
belgium.director: R√©my Belvaux, Andr√© Bonzel, Beno√Æt Poelvoorde
belgium.cultural_significance: Controversial Belgian film that satirizes media violence and documentary filmmaking.

belgium.title: The Brand New Testament
belgium.description: God lives in Brussels with his wife and daughter. His daughter decides to rebel against her father.
awards: C√©sar Award for Best Foreign Film
belgium.cultural_significance: Whimsical Belgian comedy that reimagines religious themes with Belgian humor and surrealism.

belgium.title: Two Days, One Night
belgium.description: A factory worker has one weekend to convince her colleagues to give up their bonuses so she can keep her job.
belgium.cultural_significance: Social realist drama from the Dardenne brothers, known for their humanist approach to filmmaking.

belgium.title: The Kid with a Bike
belgium.description: A young boy abandoned by his father is taken in by a hairdresser who shows him love and support.
belgium.cultural_significance: Another masterpiece from the Dardenne brothers, exploring themes of abandonment and redemption.

venezuela.title: From Afar
venezuela.description: A middle-aged man from Caracas develops an unexpected relationship with a young man from the streets.
venezuela.cultural_significance: Explores social class differences and human connection in Venezuela.
